cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 170 mi WSW of Key West, Florida and 125 mi WNW of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn W-NW today, then NW on Tuesday and curve northward, reaching Floridaâ€™s northeast Gulf coast before moving NE across Georgia/South Carolina and off the Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: West-central Florida Gulf coast from Naples northward through Tampa Bay to the Florida Big Bend
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (forecast 3-5" with isolated 7" along the west-central FL coast)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (current guidance suggests 1-3 ft in Tampa Bay area)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35-45 mph sustained possible) beginning late Wednesday night or early Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1-3 ft possible in and near Tampa Bay around time of closest approach/landfall to the north
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain, totals 3-5 inches with local 7 inches, causing localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain-bands and reduced visibility/seas from squalls may disrupt port operations
